plang.parser.ast

Interface Node

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractListNode, AbstractNode, AssignmentNode, CallNode, CompareNode, ExpressionNode, ExpressionsNode, IdentifierNode, IfNode, NumberNode, PrintNode, ReadNode, StatementsNode

    public interface Node

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • setParent

        void setParent(Node node)

      • getLine

        int getLine()
        Return the line on which this node start (i.e. the first token that represent it)
        Returns:

      • getPosition

        int getPosition()
        Return the position on which this node start
        Returns:

      • toTree

        java.lang.String toTree()
        Display this node as a part of a textual tree. Should be called recursively for all branches of the current node. E.g.: Assign(lhs=Identifier(value=helloworld), rhs=Number(10)) That is also the preferred syntax (to be easy to extend and read). Lists can be encapsulated by [] (brackets).
        Returns:

      • getParent

        Node getParent()
        The parent of this node (that is, the tree should be traversable "two-way")
        Returns:

      • getChildrens

        java.util.List<Node> getChildrens()
        Get a list of childens for this node. Order should be left to right
        Returns:

      • interpret

        java.lang.Object interpret(Interpreter interpreter)
        Allow this node to be interpreted by the Interpreter. When adding a new node, Interpreter must be extended as well. For example: 
         // New node
 public class ForNode implements Node {
 ... // other all else
 
   public Object interpret(Interpreter interpreter) {
      interpreter.interpretFor(this);
   }
 }
 
 // Edit Interpreter
 public interface Interpreter {
    Object interpretFor(ForNode node);
 }
        Also, update any implementations of Interpreter
        Parameters:
        interpreter -
        Returns:
